disease_name: Neuronopathy, distal hereditary motor, autosomal recessive 7

notes: Insertion of GAAAT is associated with disease. Expansions of endogenous AAAAT found in healthy subjects.

follow_up: Can't find info on thresholds, associated disease

disease_name: Neuronal intranuclear inclusion disease, Alzheimer disease and parkinsonism phenotype

notes: Alleles with up to 31 copies are commonly found in the population, but there is also evidence of increased ALS risk associated with 27-33 copies.
Penetrance is highly variable, making it difficult to determine a precise pathogenic threshold.
Incomplete penetrance below 300 copies.
AR for 11 repeats, AD >12 repeats. Most known patients have (GCG)+, but GCN or any polyalanine may be pathogenic

follow_up: Repeat is within a sequence missing from hg38, but these coordinates capture the repeat sequence next to the missing area.

notes: Insertion of TTTCA is associated with disease. Expansions of endogenous TTTTA found in healthy subjects.
Insertion of TGGAA is associated with disease. Expansions of endogenous TAAAA found in healthy subjects.
CAA interruptions can reduce pathogenicity (PMID: 37148549)
Penetrance is <100%; reduced penetrance has been reported in individuals with >80 CTG repeats.
Interruption with other motifs like CCG and CGG may be associated with later onset and milder phenotype.

disease_name: Intellectual disability associated with fragile site FRA2A

notes: Clinical effect of contraction is not well understood

follow_up: Unclear if  CGCCTG should be included for pathogenic threshold

notes: Interruption by other motifs like CAGA can increase stability of allele
Insertion of TTTCA is associated with disease. Expansions of endogenous TTTTA found in healthy subjects.
The number of  CCG repeats may be a risk factor for CAG instability.

disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome

notes: Insertion of TTTCA is associated with disease. Expansions of endogenous TTTTA found in healthy subjects.
Insertion of TTTCA is associated with disease, but expansions of endogenous TTTTA have NOT been found in healthy subjects.

disease_name: Autism spectrum disorder associated with fragile site FRA7A

notes: Insertion of TGAAA is associated with disease. Expansions of endogenous TAAAA found in healthy subjects.

disease_name: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and/or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
notes: Normal and pathogenic ranges are not very well defined and vary across resources.

disease_name: Hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy type VIII

notes: There is conflicting evidence for the association between this repeat expansion and Duchenne muscular dystrophy. The association was reported in a single family (PMID: 27417533). The population frequency of the proposed pathogenic allele is much higher than expected for a highly penetrant early-onset condition.

disease_name: Spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy/ Kennedy Disease
X-linked dystonia-parkinsonism (XDP) a.k.a. Dystonia 3, torsion, X-linked (DYT3)
X-linked panhypopituitarism,  X-linked mental retardation with isolated growth hormone
Fragile X syndrome (FXS), fragile X-associated tremor/ataxia syndrome (FXTAS), and fragile X-associated primary ovarian insufficiency (FXPOI/POF1)
notes: FXTAS and FXPOI are pathogenic at 55 copies or higher. FXS is pathogenic at 200 copies or higher.
